author: Michx.
habitat: Well-drained floodplain forests, riverbanks, rich mesic forests, sand and gravel-bar woodlands, old alluvial fields, and successional forests on disturbed uplands (especially near rivers and streams).
successional_status: early to late successional; moderately shade tolerant; usually establishes under pioneering species

author: L.
habitat: Native of Europe, escaped and naturalized in forests, fencerows, and roadsides.
successional_status: shade to very shade tolerant; often strong competitors in closed-canopy forest understories

author: L.
habitat: Mesic to dry, calcareous upland forests and woodlands; rich floodplain forests, locally common in areas underlain by limestone, dolomite, or calcareous shales
successional_status: moderately shade tolerant in the North but intolerant in the Piedmont; vigorous sprouting, prolific seeding enable it to pioneer on \disturbed sites; generally does not persist in late successional stages

author: (Mill.) Swingle
habitat: Disturbed forests, old fields, fencerows, road banks, and urban woodlots;
successional_status: early-successional; most common on disturbed sites; sometimes share canopy with native hardwoods into late succession

author: (Michx. f.) Fernald
habitat: Disturbed forests, old fields, fencerows, road banks, and urban woodlots;
successional_status: late successional to climax

author: (L.) Dunal
habitat: Well-drained, base-rich nutrient-poor soils
successional_status: shade tolerant; good competitor when undisturbed but does not spread into either early- or late-successional forest types

author: DC.
habitat: Mesic to dry forests and old fields.
successional_status: shade tolerant; may establish in any successional stage; best in open, disturbed forest sites in early succession

author: Walter
habitat: Mesic  upland forest, stram banks
successional_status: shade tolerant greatest in seedlings and declining with age; responds positively to overstory removal

author: (Wangenh.) K. Koch
habitat: Mesic to rather dry upland forests and woodlands, well-drained floodplain forests, and high-elevation deciduous forests
successional_status: shade intolerant (generally); gradually accumulates and develops under moderate canopies

author: (Mill.) Sweet
habitat: Mesic to dry upland forests, but most numerous in moderately to strongly base-rich soils
successional_status: intermediate; shade tolerant in S portion of its range, intolerant in N portion; persists in some climax communities

author: (Wangenh.) Sarg.
habitat: Mesic to dry upland forests and woodlands; tolerates a wide range of soil conditions
successional_status: slow growing, intermediate shade tolerance

author: (Lam. ex Poir.) Nutt.
habitat: Mesic to dry upland forests and woodlands; tolerant of a range of soil chemistries, occurring widely on base-rich to extremely infertile substrates
successional_status: shade intolerant (generally), but probably a climax species in moist sites

author: (Marshall) Borkh.
habitat: Dry and dry-mesic upland forests and woodlands, most common on dry, rocky ridges with oaks and pines; absent from highly calcareous areas
successional_status: early-successional

author: L.
habitat: Floodplains, mesic to dry upland; nutrient rich
successional_status: early-successional; colonizes old fields as well as recently disturbed sites

author: L.
habitat: Dry to mesic upland forest, calcareous soils
successional_status: moderately shade tolerant; often increases in dominance on sites experiencing disturbance

author: L.
habitat: Mesic to dry upland forests, woodlands, and barrens

author: L. f.
habitat: Mesic and dry-mesic upland forests, boulder field forests, seepage swamp hummocks, clearings and borders

author: L.
habitat: Mesic and dry-mesic upland forests, boulder field forests, seepage swamp hummocks, clearings and borders

author: Walter
habitat: Mesic to dry upland forests, well-drained floodplain forests, rocky woodlands, and old fields.

author: (Wendl. f.) K. Koch
habitat: Dry, thinly-canopied, shaly or rocky forests, woodlands, and edges.

author: L.
habitat: Weedy tree in old fields, fencerows, and roadsides; also scattered in a range of natural habitats, including swamp forests, depression ponds, dune woodlands and scrub, rocky woodlands, and the understory of mesic to dry upland forests.

author: Thunb.
habitat: Mesic to dry forests, woodlands, old fields, fencerows, and roadsides

author: (Thunb.) Sieb.
habitat: Mesic forests, floodplains, and disturbed habitats, particularly in and near urban areas

author: Ehrh.
habitat: Mesic to dry-mesic upland forests, very well-drained floodplain terraces, and bluffs; most common on well-drained, acidic, nutrient-poor soils
successional_status: late successional/climax

author: L.
habitat: Mesic to dry mesic upland forest, base-rich soils, well-drained
successional_status: pioneer

author: Marshall
habitat: Seepage swamps, fens, and rocky stream banks on calcareous or mafic substrates

author: Marshall
habitat: Floodplain forests, alluvial and tidal swamps, seepage swamps, depression swamps and ponds, wet flatwoods, and other wetlands

author: L.
habitat: Mesic to dry mesic upland forest

author: (L.) A. Gray
habitat: Alluvial swamps, seepage swamps, bogs, ponds, and depression swamps

author: L.
habitat: Mesic to fairly dry, often rocky upland forests, boulder fields, and stream bankon; base-rich substrates

author: L.
habitat: Rich soils of mesic upland forests, floodplain forests, old fields, and fencerows; occasionally in dry, rocky woodlands on mafic or calcareous rocks
successional_status: shade intolerant

author: (L.) Blume
habitat: Mesic and dry-mesic upland forests, well-drained floodplain forests, seepage swamps, alluvial swamps, and tidal swamps; on uplands, it is most abundant in base-rich soils

author: L.
habitat: Mesic to dry mesic upland forest
successional_status: shade intolerant, pioneer

author: (Rupr.) Herder
habitat: Mesic and dry-mesic forests, old fields, and fencerows

author: Marshall
habitat: Mesic to dry upland forests, rocky woodlands, seepage swamps, floodplain forests and swamps, wet flatwoods, and depression pons

author: (Thunb.) Steud.
habitat: Fencerows, old fields, roadcuts, old quarries, clearings, burned or cut-over forests, and sandy or rocky river shores

author: Lamb.
habitat: Dry, rocky or frequently burned forests, woodlands, cliffs, bluffs

author: L.
habitat: Mesic to dry upland forests and woodlands, and montane alluvial forests

author: Mill.
habitat: Dry old fields and forests, rocky woodlands and barrens, cliffs, and outcrop
successional_status: early succesional

author: L.
habitat: Floodplain forests and swamps, montane alluvial forests, stream banks, flood-scoured rocky bars and shores, and disturbed alluvial habitats

author: (L.) L.
habitat: Mesic and dry-mesic (occasionally dry) upland forests, old fields

author: (L.) Batsch
habitat: Old fields, old homesites, roadsides, and waste ground

author: Ehrh.
habitat: Wet to dry forests and woodlands throughout

author: L.
habitat: Mesic to dry mesic upland forest, well drained bottomlands

author: Münchh.
habitat: Dry to, occasionally, mesic upland forests and woodlands; most characteristic of dry, acidic, nutrient-poor soils

author: Michx.
habitat: Dry to mesic upland forests and woodlands, mostly acidic and nutrient-poor; occasionally in wet flatwoods and other low, somewhat poorly drained habitats

author: Nutt.
habitat: Well-drained floodplain forests, alluvial swamps, tidal swamps, wet flatwoods, and low mesic upland forests.

author: Engelm.
habitat: Dry to mesic upland forests and rocky woodlands, usually on soils weathered from calcareous or mafic rock

author: L.
habitat: Dry to occasionally mesic upland forests, woodlands, and shale barrens

author: L.
habitat: Mesic to dry mesic upland forest, mid to high elev.
successional_status: faster grower

author: Lam.
habitat: Dry to mesic upland forest

author: L.
habitat: Mesic to dry secondary forests, old fields, fencerows

author: (Michx.) Shinners
habitat: Mesic to dry, acidic forests, seepage swamp hummocks, and stream banks. Common throughout.

author: Thunb.
habitat: Wetland and upland forests, clearings, old fields

author: Porter
habitat: Mesic to dry forests, woodlands, barrens, clearings, old fields, pastures, and road banks

author: Poir.
habitat: Natural and disturbed habitats, including floodplain forests, swamps (all types), wet flatwoods, mesic to dry upland forests, woodlands, clearings, old fields, and roadsides

author: Maxim.
habitat: Mesic to dry-mesic (rarely dry) upland forests, clearings, old fields, and roadsides; especially abundant in base-rich soils.

author: (L.) R. Bolli
habitat: Damp to wet soil in fields, clearings, ditches, roadsides, floodplain forests, and swamps

author: (Nutt.) Nees
habitat: Dry to mesic forests and woodlands, old fields, fencerows

author: L.
habitat: rich cove forests, rocky dry-mesic forests on mafic or calcareous rocks, and basic or calcareous boulderfield forests

author: L.
habitat: Wetland habitats, including floodplain forests, tidal and nontidal swamps, and upland depressions; also in mesic upland forests

author: Muhl.
habitat: Mesic to dry mesic upland forest, rocky, disturbed habitats

author: L.
habitat: Mesic to dry upland forests.

author: L.
habitat: Open, wet to dry habitats.

author: Fernald
habitat: Open, wet to dry habitats.
